title: 1. Supermarket Navigation
en: Supermarkets are divided into sections like fruit vegetables meat dairy and frozen food. Signs above aisles help you find items.

title: 2. Reading Aisle Signs
en: Aisle signs list the main items available in each row to help you navigate

title: 3. Checking Price Labels
en: Price labels are located on the shelf under each product

title: 4. Understanding Unit Price
en: The unit price shows cost per 100g or per kg making it easier to compare products.

title: 5. Special Offers
en: Discounts and specials are often highlighted with bright tags.

title: 6. Using Trolleys and Baskets
en: Trolleys and baskets are provided at the entrance for carrying items.

title: 7. Queuing at Checkout
en: Always line up and wait for your turn at the cashier.

title: 8. Self-Checkout Machines
en: Self-checkout allows you to scan and pay for items yourself.

title: 9. Payment Methods
en: You can pay by cash card or contactless (tap).

title: 10. Bagging Groceries
en: Bring reusable bags or buy bags at checkout.

title: 11. Checking Expiry Dates
en: Always check expiry dates on perishable items before buying

title: 12. Fresh Food Sections
en: Supermarkets often have bakery deli and butcher sections.

title: 13. Asking Staff for Help
en: Staff can help you find items if you cannot locate them.

title: 14. Loyalty Cards
en: Some supermarkets offer loyalty cards to collect points.

title: 15. Opening Hours
en: Most supermarkets open from 7am to 9pm.

title: 16. Weighing Produce
en: Some fruits and vegetables need to be weighed before checkout.

title: 17. Storage Advice
en: Labels may include storage advice for fresh food.

title: 18. Halal/Kosher/Vegetarian Products
en: Special sections may stock halal kosher or vegetarian food.

title: 19. Weekend Crowds
en: Supermarkets are busiest on weekends.

title: 20. Returning Items
en: You can return faulty items with a receipt.
